title: Transplanting a Tomato plant in a 4" pot to a gallon pot

tasks.task: Potting up a tomato plant from a four-inch pot to a one-gallon container
subtasks: Gather materials (soil, Mycorrhiza fungus, pot)
Open the four-inch tomato plant pot carefully
Infuse the root zone with Mycorrhiza fungus
Plant the tomato plant as deep as possible, removing lower leaves
Fill the new pot with soil, avoiding pressing down to prevent oxygen deprivation
Add water and a plant stake for support

tasks.task: Preparing a tomato plant for transplanting
subtasks: Identifying the appropriate time to pot up a young tomato plant
Selecting a larger container (from four inches to one gallon)
Ensuring proper depth and positioning of the plant in the new container
Managing the root system (opening roots, avoiding root damage)
Maintaining soil aeration by not compacting
Ensuring adequate soil moisture upon planting

tasks.task: Upgrading a young tomato plant to a larger container
subtasks: Transferring a four-inch tomato plant to a one-gallon container
Encouraging root growth with Mycorrhiza assistance
Providing additional support (plant stake) for the growing plant
Prepare soil and Mycorrhiza
Open plant pot carefully
Inoculate roots with Mycorrhiza
Plant deeply, remove lower leaves
Fill pot without compacting soil
Add water and support stake
Upgrade container size
Ensure proper planting depth
Manage root system
Maintain soil aeration
Support growing plant
